snippet: The judge said Army officials may not have acted independent of external politics and possible pressure from senior Pentagon officials when they decided to turn down a plea offer.
abstract: Col James L Pohl, military judge overseeing court-martial of Brig Gen Jeffrey A Sinclair on sexual assault charges, brings trial to halt, suggesting that Army official Lt Gen Joseph Anderson may have been improperly influenced by political considerations in his handling of case; orders that Sinclair be allowed to offer plea agreement on lesser charges.

byline.original: By ALAN BLINDER and RICHARD A. OPPEL Jr
byline.contributor: Alan Blinder reported from Fort Bragg, and Richard A. Oppel Jr. from New York.

lead_paragraph: The judge said Army officials may not have acted independent of external politics and possible pressure from senior Pentagon officials when they decided to turn down a plea offer.

headline.main: Faulting Army, Judge Puts Off Assault Case
headline.print_headline: Faulting Army, Judge Puts Off Assault Case

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
